definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic

sentences.english: The landscape will get more cluttered, the air and water even dirtier.
sentences.chinese: 景色會變得更加雜亂，空氣和水也會變得愈發骯髒。

sentences.english: The desk was covered with a litter of documents.
sentences.chinese: 書桌上滿滿地放着一堆雜亂的文件。

sentences.english: Selfish picnickers litter the beach with food wrappers.
sentences.chinese: 自私的野餐者亂扔包裝紙使海灘雜亂不堪。

sentences.english: In more complex methods, the above nesting could get even more cluttered.
sentences.chinese: 在更復雜的方法中，上述嵌套甚至會變得更爲雜亂。

sentences.english: The rate cuts will soothe a little bit of jangled nerves at this time.
sentences.chinese: 這時降息可以稍稍平息人們雜亂的神經。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was in a complete mess.
sentences.chinese: 我到家時，屋裏雜亂不堪。

sentences.english: Maybe it's just a fantasy, emerged from the disordered life.
sentences.chinese: 也許只是個臆想，從雜亂無章的生活裏蹦出的臆想。

sentences.english: All of the stuff on the fridge gave the impression of a cluttered room.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱裏所有的東西都給人一種雜亂無章的印象。

sentences.english: After too many operations, the ciphertexts would eventually become too noisy.
sentences.chinese: 經過過多的運算操作，暗文將最終變得雜亂無章。

sentences.english: Now, these pictures can be a bit messy.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些照片是雜亂無章的。

sentences.english: Cluttered or disorganized apps are difficult to understand and hard to use.
sentences.chinese: 雜亂或無組織的應用程序既難以理解又不便使用。

sentences.english: It promiscuously plunders other languages and delights in neologisms .
sentences.chinese: 它雜亂地掠奪其它語言，並以增加新詞爲樂。

sentences.english: Hundreds of photos were scattered higgledy -piggledy across the floor.
sentences.chinese: 數以百計的照片雜亂散佈在地板上。

sentences.english: All kinds of vehicles weltered together.
sentences.chinese: 各種車輛雜亂無章地混在一起。

definition: arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
